intro: Dodecatheon pauciflorum subsp. monanthum, commonly known as the single-flowered glory-of-the-snow, is a member of the Primulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States, typically found in moist, woodland habitats. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive yellow throat. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in a fine pubescence. The species is characterized by its reduced floral structure, with only a single flower per stem, distinguishing it from other members of the Dodecatheon genus.
